edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.coinTossing
Class CTBlumPartyTwo

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.coinTossing.CTBlumPartyTwo
All Implemented Interfaces:
CTPartyTwo, Covert, Malicious, OneSidedSimulation, ProtocolSecLevel, SecurityLevel, SemiHonest, StandAlone
public class CTBlumPartyTwo
extends java.lang.Object
implements CTPartyTwo, StandAlone, Malicious

This class plays as party two of coin tossing Blum protocol, which tosses a single bit.

This protocol is fully secure under the stand-alone simulation-based definitions.

For more information see M. Blum. Coin Flipping by Phone. IEEE COMPCOM, 1982.

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 6.1 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Constructor Summary
CTBlumPartyTwo(Channel channel, CmtReceiver receiver, java.security.SecureRandom random)
          Constructor that sets the given values.
 
Method Summary
 CTOutput toss()
          Execute the following protocol: "SAMPLE a random bit b2 <- {0,1} WAIT for COMMIT.commit on b1 SEND b2 to P1 RUN subprotocol COMMIT.decommit to receive b1 IF COMMIT.decommit returns INVALID REPORT ERROR (cheat attempt) ELSE OUTPUT b1 XOR b2."

Method Detail

toss

public CTOutput toss()
              throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     CommitValueException,
                     CheatAttemptException
Execute the following protocol:

"SAMPLE a random bit b2 <- {0,1}

WAIT for COMMIT.commit on b1

SEND b2 to P1

RUN subprotocol COMMIT.decommit to receive b1

IF COMMIT.decommit returns INVALID REPORT ERROR (cheat attempt)

ELSE OUTPUT b1 XOR b2."

Specified by:
toss in interface CTPartyTwo
Returns:
CTOutput contains the tossed "coin".
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem in the serialization mechanism
java.io.IOException - can occur in the commit phase.
CommitValueException - can occur in case the protocol uses an ElGamal receiver.
CheatAttemptException - if party one suspects that party two is trying to cheat.
